content.body: Maybe this proposal is pointing to a need to split off accessor from the decorators proposal so that it's not blocked on them?
`accessor` is sort of split off. It was originally introduced in Grouped and Auto-Accessors and brought over to decorators to meet implementor requirements
content.formatted_body: accessor is sort of split off. It was originally introduced in Grouped and Auto-Accessors and brought over to decorators to meet implementor requirements

content.body: I think I would prefer for these things to be reified as accessors and not directly visible in descriptors, to avoid making descriptors being more complicated
content.formatted_body: I think I would prefer for these things to be reified as accessors and not directly visible in descriptors, to avoid making descriptors being more complicated

content.body: The one with the validate keyword
Or the `class Foo { accessor x = 2; }` syntax?
content.formatted_body: Or the class Foo { accessor x = 2; } syntax?

content.body: I meant that `class Foo { validate x(val) { ... } }` looks a lot like `class Foo { set x(val) { ... } }`, so I'd expect similar performance
content.formatted_body: I meant that class Foo { validate x(val) { ... } } looks a lot like class Foo { set x(val) { ... } }, so I'd expect similar performance

content.body: I'd also expect similar perf with the decorator example, since I'm literally seeing a function attached to the property
